etymology.description: Depicts wheat: line for ear, upturns for leaves, downturns for stem/roots -> borrowed for 'to come'; additions like 止 (zhǐ, 'foot') added and later removed
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting wheat, the character 來(lái, 'to come') was borrowed for its phonetic similarity to the word meaning 'to come'. The components effectively illustrate parts of the wheat plant, which provided an analogy for movement or arrival, hence its borrowed use.

examples.chinese: 请你来(請你來)，一起享受美好时光(一起享受美好時光)。
examples.pinyin: qǐng nǐ lái, yìqǐ xiǎngshòu měihǎo shíguāng.
examples.english: Please come and enjoy a wonderful time.

examples.chinese: 春风吹来(春風吹來)，花儿绽放(花兒綻放)。
examples.english: As the spring breeze comes, the flowers bloom.

examples.chinese: 我在门口等你来(我在門口等你來)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ zài ménkǒu děng nǐ lái.
examples.english: I am waiting for you at the door.
